titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Emilie S. Coles papers, 1880-1923
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection consists of correspondence directed to Emilie Coles largely from editors concerning her writings, which were published in newspapers and magazines. Also included are personal letters from Mary J. Porter (a "pen" friend) and others, including Helen E. Brown, Glenn Frank, Sam H. Hall, Edward D.G. and Samuel I. Prime, Charles A. Stoddard, and John H. Vincent.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Emilie S. Coles Papers, 1880-1923, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Author of prose and verse, from Scotch Plains (Union Co.), N.J.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of correspondence directed to Emilie Coles largely from editors concerning her writings, which were published in newspapers and magazines. Also included are personal letters from Mary J. Porter (a "pen" friend) and others, including Helen E. Brown, Glenn Frank, Sam H. Hall, Edward D.G. and Samuel I. Prime, Charles A. Stoddard, and John H. Vincent.

odd.p: Cataloged in 1952; Description from Guide. Originally part of the Marmaduke Floyd Collection.
